name: makrout
ingredients: 500 g of wheat semolina (medium or coarse)
For the filling: 250 g of date paste (or almond/fig paste), 30 g of sesame seeds
For the syrup: 500 g of sugar, 250 ml of water, juice of 1/2 lemon (or honey/orange blossom syrup)
steps: Prepare the syrup: Pour the water into a saucepan. Bring to a boil with the sugar and lemon juice. Let it thicken for 10 minutes over low heat. Remove from heat.
Prepare the dough: Mix the flour with the semolina in a bowl. Melt the butter and add it along with the oil. Knead to obtain a homogeneous mixture.
Incorporate tablespoons of boiling water one at a time to obtain a smooth dough. Let it rest.
Prepare the filling: Mix the date paste with the sesame seeds (and a bit of cinnamon or orange blossom water, optional).
Shaping: Form rolls of dough 3-4 cm thick. Make a hollow in the center and fill it with the date paste. Close the dough and flatten slightly. Cut into pieces (about 3 cm).
Fry the makrouts until they are crispy. Drain on absorbent paper.
Dip the hot makrouts into the hot syrup. Sprinkle with sesame seeds to serve.
